questions.question_text:
The Health and Safety Training Project is a critical project within a programme. Due to resource constraints within the programme, the programme manager has been appointed as both executive and project manager of the Health and Safety Training Project.
Is this an appropriate action, and why?

choices.B: Yes, because the programme manager can be appointed as executive of the programme's projects
choices.D: No, because the role of executive and project manager should remain separate for governance reasons
choices.C: No, because the programme manager's role should remain separate from that of the project's executive
choices.A: Yes, because the programme manager can ensure that the project is aligned to the programme outcomes

discussion.content: it is B (The programme manager may be the executive for one or more of the projects)

questions.question_text:
During the 'initiating a project' process the Training Delivery Manager identified that there would be additional work in auditing the delivery of the classroom-based health and safety training course. This work will have to be carried out by existing staff members. The project manager recorded this information as a dis-benefit in the benefits management approach and asked the Training Delivery Manager to capture the team's current workload.
Is this an appropriate action for the prepare the 'benefits management approach' activity, and why?

choices.B: Yes, because the Training Delivery Manager perceives the additional workload as a negative outcome
choices.C: No, because the additional workload is an additional cost that should be included in the business case
choices.D: No, because the additional workload is an issue that should be recorded in the issue register for resolution
choices.A: Yes, because the baseline for the current workload needs to be captured in order to measure the dis-benefit

discussion.content: This should be "No, because the additional workload is an additional cost that should be included in the business case" so C is correct

A) Yes, because the baseline for the current workload needs to be captured in order to measure the dis-benefit is the correct answer.

In PRINCE2, the benefits management approach prepared during 'initiating a project' should outline both benefits and dis-benefits. Capturing the current workload provides a baseline to measure if the additional auditing causes a dis-benefit later.

questions.question_text:
The Health and Safety Training Project has been commissioned in response to recent government legislation relating to health and safety on construction sites.
While the legislation has been finalized, it will only become clear how the governments accrediting agency will interpret the legislation in key areas as they accredit the products and trainers.
How should the project manager respond to this situation when preparing the project product description, and why?

choices.D: By allowing the acceptance criteria to evolve, because the executive should approve the finalized project product description
choices.A: By prioritizing the acceptance criteria, because it may not be possible to meet all acceptance criteria
choices.C: By allowing the acceptance criteria to evolve, because the project manager should include information through change control when it is known
choices.B: By prioritizing the acceptance criteria, because the acceptance criteria should form a list of measurable attributes

discussion.content:
C

The other options are not as appropriate because:

A. By prioritizing the acceptance criteria, because it may not be possible to meet all acceptance criteria: This option is not valid because prioritizing the acceptance criteria does not address the issue of uncertainty or ambiguity in the legislation or accreditation. 
B. By prioritizing the acceptance criteria, because the acceptance criteria should form a list of measurable attributes: This option is not relevant to the question, which is about how to respond to the situation of unclear legislation or accreditation. 
D. By allowing the acceptance criteria to evolve, because the executive should approve the finalized project product description: This option is partially correct, but it does not explain why allowing the acceptance criteria to evolve is a good response to the situation.

choices.D: Project support, because they should advise the project manager of any changes that will affect the business case
choices.A: Project assurance, because they should ensure continued alignment of the project with corporate standards
choices.B: Project assurance, because they should be involved in assessing the impact of changes on the business case
choices.C: Project support, because they should ensure that the business case is baselined and kept under change control

discussion.content: B. Project assurance, because they should be involved in assessing the impact of changes on the business case
